intro: Crepis friesii, commonly known as the Fries' hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a cluster of small, tubular disk flowers. Crepis friesii is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
